V149  Q45 EC EMPLOMENT POL PREFERNCE - RESP                                    
                                                                               
Location:  237    MD1: 00                                                      
Width:       2    MD2: 11                                                      
                                                                               
Q.45  Another important problem for European Union (European                   
Community) is unemployment. The President of the European                      
Commission has proposed to raise funds for a massive                           
employment programme in order to fight unemployment. Others                    
argue that the completion of the Single European Market alone                  
will promote economic growth and will be the best remedy for                   
the current problems of unemployment. What is your opinion?                    
Should the European Union (Euopen Community) launch a massive                  
employment programme, or should it rather concentrate on the                   
completion of the Single Market? (SHOW CARD)                                   
                                                                               
Q.45a  Where would you place yourself on this scale?                           
-------------------------------------------------------------                  
                                                                               
    01.  Launch a massive employment programme                                 
    02.                                                                        
    03.                                                                        
    04.                                                                        
    05.                                                                        
    06.                                                                        
    07.                                                                        
    08.                                                                        
    09.                                                                        
    10.  Concentrate on completion of Single Market                            
                                                                               
    11.  DK                                                                    
    00.  NA

Q.46  Still another issue with the European Union (European                    
Community) has to do with national borders. What do you think?                 
Should European Union (European Community) continue to remove                  
national borders an let people move freely between the                         
countries, or should we re-introduce tigther border controls                   
in order be better able to effectively fight crime in (OUR                     
COUNTRY)? (SHOW CARD)                                                          
                                                                               
Q.46a  Where would you place yourself on this scale?

on this scale? (READ OUT IN TURN LIMITED PARTY LIST)                           
                                                                               
Q.46b_1  <Preference for border controls - party placement>                    
                                                                               
Party A

Belgium: (VLD) Vlaamse Liberalen en Demokraten (ex PVV)                        
   <Flemish language regions>

   Soziale Union

V173  Q47 POL PROB MOST IMP - 1ST                                              
                                                                               
Location:  285    MD1: 00                                                      
Width:       2    MD2: 12                                                      
                                                                               
Q.47  I would like to hear your views on some political issues                 
and problems. (SHOW CARD) Which of the following issues do you                 
consider the most important? Which comes second? Which third?                  
                                                                               
Q.47_1  The most important political issues                                    
--------------------------------------------------------------                 
                                                                               
<Last trend modified: EB31A  Q.218/220>                                        
                                                                               
<See note 1 for description of national political issues>                      
                                                                               
    01.  a) (NATIONAL ISSUE NUMBER 1)                                          
    02.  b) Fighting unemployment                                              
    03.  c) Securing stable prices                                             
    04.  d) (NATIONAL ISSUE NUMBER 2)                                          
    05.  e) Furthering the political unification of Western                    
            Europe                                                             
    06.  f) Solving the immigration problems                                   
    07.  g)(NATIONAL ISSUE NUMBER 3)                                           
    08.  h) Reducing of agricultural surpluses                                 
    09.  i) Protecting of the environment                                      
    10.  j) (NATIONAL ISSUE NUMBER 4)                                          
    11.  k) Fighting crime                                                     
                                                                               
    12.  DK                                                                    
    00.  NA

V176  Q48A POL PROB MOST IMP 1ST - BEST PARTY                                  
                                                                               
Location:  291    MD1: 00                                                      
Width:       2    MD2: 97                                                      
                                                                               
Q.48a  Which party do you think would be best at ...                           
(MENTION MOST IMPORTANT ISSUE OF Q.47)?                                        
                                                                               
(PARTY LIST: NATIONAL VOTE RECALL - SHOW CARD - ONE ANSWER                     
ONLY)

Q.50b  Do you think that (MENTION THIRD IMPORTANT ISSUE OF                     
Q.47) is mainly dealt with today at the regional, national or                  
European level?

V224  Q1_DK EC FUTURE - DENMARKS COLLABORATION                                 
                                                                               
Location:  344    MD1: 5                                                       
Width:       1    MD2: 9                                                       
                                                                               
QUESTIONS FOR DENMARK ONLY                                                     
                                                                               
Q.1_DK  I will now mention a number of views on collaboration                  
with the EU (EC).                                                              
                                                                               
Which is closest to your opinion? (SHOW CARD)                                  
-------------------------------------------------------------                  
                                                                               
    1.  Denmark should leave the EU (EC)                                       
    2.  Regarding the collaboration with the EU (EC), each                     
        member country should have complete independence and                   
        have a right of veto on EU (EC)-decisions                              
    3.  Each Country should increasingly let the EU (EC) make                  
        the decisions and conform to the Union (Community)                     
    4.  The EU (EC) should, eventually, develop into a United                  
        States of Europe with a joint European Government                      
                                                                               
    5.  DK                                                                     
    9.  Inap., only interviewed in Denmark <not coded 7 in V7>

V283  Q5_DK EUROP ELECTION VOTE - DECISION                                     
                                                                               
Location:  403    MD1: 0                                                       
Width:       1    MD2: 4                                                       
                                                                               
Q.5_DK  When you made up your mind for the European Elections,                 
when did you decide to vote as you did? Was it in the last                     
days before the European Election, was it earlier during the                   
election campaign, or did you know already before the campaign                 
how you were going to vote?                                                    
--------------------------------------------------------------                 
                                                                               
    1.  In last days                                                           
    2.  During campaign                                                        
    3.  Before campaign                                                        
                                                                               
    4.  DK                                                                     
    0.  NA                                                                     
    9.  Inap., only interviewed in Denmark and

V306  D5A ELECTORAL PARTICIPATION - NATIONAL                                   
                                                                               
Location:  441    MD1: 0                                                       
Width:       1    MD2: 3                                                       
                                                                               
D.5a  The last General Election took place in (INSERT MONTH                    
AND YEAR OF LAST GENERAL ELECTION). For one reason or another,                 
many people in (OUR COUNTRY) did not vote in that election.                    
Could you please think back to that last election, the one in                  
(INSERT MONTH AND YEAR OF LAST GENERAL ELECTION). Did you vote                 
in that election or not?                                                       
--------------------------------------------------------------                 
                                                                               
    1.  Voted                                   (GO TO D.5)                    
    2.  Did not vote                            (GO TO D.5b)                   
                                                                               
    3.  Can't remember/refused                  (GO TO D.5b)                   
    0.  NA

         of a company

         head, junior manager, teacher, technician)

D.21b  b) (IF NOT DOING ANY PAID WORK CURRENTLY - CODE 1 TO 4                  
in D.21a)  Did he/she do any paid work in the past? What was                   
his/her last occupation?

 SELF EMPLOYED

         accountant, architect, ...)

         person

         company                                                               
                                                                               
 EMPLOYED

         accountant, architect)                                                
    07.  General management, director or top management                        
         (managing directors, director general, other                          
         director)                                                             
    08.  Middle management, other management (department                       
         head, junior manager, teacher, technician)                            
    09.  Employed position, working mainly at a desk

    11.  Employed position, not at a desk, but in a service

V351  D29 INCOME HH

NO QUESTION D.28                                                               
                                                                               
D.29  We also need some information about the income of this                   
household to be able to analyse the survey results for                         
different types of households. Here is a list of income                        
groups. (SHOW CARD)                                                            
                                                                               
Please count the total wages and salaries per month of all                     
members of this household; all pensions and all social                         
insurance benefits; child allowances and any other income                      
like rents, etc... Of course, your answer as all other                         
replies in this interview will be treated confidentially                       
and referring back to you or your household will be                            
impossible. Please give me the letter <non-alphabetical,                       
irregular order> of the income group your household falls                      
into before tax and other deductions.                                          
------------------------------------------------------------                   
                                                                               
<Last trend: EB41.0  D.29>

P.7  Region I                                                                  
-------------                                                                  
                                                                               
<In the cases of France, West Germany, Italy, Ireland and the                  
United Kingdom "Region I" corresponds to the variable labelled                 
"Province" in earlier Eurobarometers up to number 31. If                       
indicated, "Region I" units are consistent with the EUROSTAT                   
nomenclature for regional statistics (NUTS).>                                  
                                                                               
France  <EUROSTAT NUTS II LEVEL>

V362  P7 REGION II (REGION I RECODED)                                          
                                                                               
Location:  529    MD1: 99                                                      
Width:       2                                                                 
                                                                               
P.7R  Region II                                                                
---------------                                                                
                                                                               
<Only in the case of West Germany "Region II" corresponds to                   
the variable labelled "Region" in earlier Eurobarometers up                    
to 31. If indicated, "Region II" units are consistent with the                 
EUROSTAT nomenclature for regional statistics (NUTS).>                         
                                                                               
France  <EUROSTAT NUTS I LEVEL>                                                
                                                                               
<Zeat>

V365  C4 SOCIO PROF STATUS (OCCUPATION RECODE)                                 
                                                                               
Location:  533    MD1: 0                                                       
Width:       2                                                                 
                                                                               
C.4  SOCIO PROFESSIONAL STATUS                                                 
                                                                               
<Roughly half of the representative sample of the European                     
Community public was without paid work. Basing cross-analyses                  
on "occupation" (D.15a) would exclude half of the respondents                  
from analysis. An alternative is to base analyses on (non-                     
marxist) concept of "objective social class" using "occupation                 
of the head of household" as reference. In order to classify                   
as many respondents as possible with respect to their socio-                   
professional setting, a new classification was created called                  
"socio-professional status" of the main income earner (MIE).                   
The following standard was used if the respondent is the MIE:                  
For those in paid work it is based on the respondents' own                     
present occupation (D.15a). For those not in paid work,                        
"former occupation" (D.15b) was used, if applicable. If the                    
respondent is not the MIE, the occupation of the "person who                   
contributes most to the household income" (D.21a) was used                     
and if the head of household was not performing paid works                     
at the time of the interview, his or her "former occupation"                   
(D.21b) was used, if applicable.                                               
                                                                               
Consequently, socio-professional status is a classification                    
"that comes as close to the respondent himself/herself as                      
possible" but that draws upon additional background infor-                     
mation to the extent necessary and available, in order to                      
avoid a single measure of interviewees' socio-professional                     
setting and to include the maximum number of respondents in                    
the respective analyses. For more details see standard                         
report EUROBAROMETER 41, July 1994, Brussels, A52 f.>                          
--------------------------------------------------------------                 
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
                                                                               
             (C) Zentralarchiv fuer empirische Sozialforschung Koeln           
ZA 2491 / ICPSR 6535          EUROBAROMETER 41.1                     Page  823
------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
                                                                               
V365  C4 SOCIO PROF STATUS (OCCUPATION RECODE)                     (continued) 
                                                                               
    01.  Farmer and fisher                                                     
    02.  Professionals                                                         
    03.  Owner of a shop, craftsmen, other self employed                       
         position                                                              
    04.  Business proprietors, owner of a company                              
    05.  Employed professional                                                 
    06.  General management                                                    
    07.  Middle management                                                     
    08.  Employed position, working mainly at a desk                           
    09.  Employed position , not at a desk but travelling                      
    10.  Employed position, not at a desk but in a service                     
         job                                                                   
    11.  Supervisors                                                           
    12.  Skilled manual workers                                                
    13.  Other (unskilled) manual worker                                       
                                                                               
    00.      Question Q.47 (V173, V174, V175)                                          
     --------------------------------                                          
                                                                               
     National Political Issues                                                 
                                                                               
         France                                                                
              a) Improving education and training to prepare                   
                 the future                                                    
              d) Fighting social inequalities                                  
              g) Securing the welfare (health care, pensions etc.)             
              j) Securing the balance between cities and the                   
                 countryside                                                   
                                                                               
         Belgium                                                               
              a) Maintaining the unity of Belgium                              
              d) Reducing public debt                                          
              g) Fighting political corruption                                 
              j) Securing pensions in the future                               
                                                                               
         Netherlands                                                           
              a) Fight the abuse of social security                            
              d) Strengthen Dutch industry                                     
              g) Ensure good old age pensions                                  
              j) Bring politics closer to the citizens                         
                                                                               
         Germany (East and West)                                               
              a) Promoting equal living conditions in East                     
                 and West Germany                                              
              d) Solving the fiscal crisis                                     
              g) Peaceful democratisation in Eastern Europe                    
              j) Securing the welfare state                                    
                                                                               
         Italy                                                                 
              a) Reducing public debt                                          
              d) Alleviate north south differences                             
              g) Effectuating the institutional and                            
                 electoral reform                                              
              j) Establishing rules for the television sector                  
                                                                               
         Luxembourg                                                            
              a) Developing a national University                              
              d) Harmonising the pension schemes in a socially                 
                 justified manner                                              
              g) Allowing citizens of other EU(EC) countries to                
                 vote and run in general elections                             
              j) To depoliticize the written press
